name: Hotel de la Cite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's not much I can add to the reviews here. It's a superb hotel in a wonderful location.
reviews.title: Simply the best way to enjoy Carassonne

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd certainly recommend investigating Gourmet Package deals that incorporate meals at the mitchelin stared restaurant La Barbacane.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel - spoil yourselves and stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's also well worth trying out the attached Le Jardin de l'Evêque restaurant hidden away in the complex.
reviews.title: The place to stay in Carcassonne

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I visited Carcassonne for a two night break to celebrate our anniversary, and chose to stay in this hotel. Our room was sumptuous, with doors opening directly onto the pool terrace area. We had welcome chocolates, and a hand written note wishing us a happy anniversary - how nice. The room was very well equipped with an abundance of smellies and handy items, there was even an umbrella in the room for our use if needed. The hotel is over 100 years old, and they have an 'audio tour' which is free to do and which we found very interesting. It gave us the opportunity to have a good look around the beautiful rooms and gardens, and tell us about the history of the this lovely hotel. The staff were all lovely - helpful, polite, warm and friendly. I really couldn't fault this hotel at all - the only thing which didn't really suit me was the firmness of the mattress - but it was so peaceful, I still slept fairly well, even though my preference is to have a softer mattress.
reviews.title: Stunning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are going to Languedoc Roussillon, you have to go to Carcassonne and if you are going to Carcassonne, you have to stay at the Hotel de la Cite. It’s a pure delight: located within the walls of the medieval city right next to the Basilica. The rooms are small but gorgeous, with a tiny separate dressing room, a small bathroom and a separate toilet. We had also had quite a large terrace overlooking the hotel garden and the city walls.
reviews.title: A step back in time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great setting inside the old walled city of carcassone, michelin starred restaurant, great bar with music some of the evenings
reviews.title: pretty amazing hotel and setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside is that the pool is somewhat basic - but this is a pretty amazing hotel in a restored building inside the old city
reviews.title: Romantic, Oui Oui!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were en route to Nice and planned to stay in this formidable establishment. The Hotel location was wonderful. Excellent Service. Excellent Food. Excellent service.
reviews.title: Beautiful, Beautiful place to stay
Glamourous hotel and location
reviews.text: France...La Cite m'apelle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment you are met in the car parking area by the courtesy bus the trip just gets better & better!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in beautiful location
What a setting!
reviews.text: The setting in Carcassonne does help you forgive a few small failings of the hotel. The city is stunning and living within in it with the exquisite gardens and pool was amazing. We had only booked the basic rooms and I am glad we were only staying one night because they were quite small and basic with little view of anything.

My only complaints were that reception seemed very overworked and we struggled to be dealt with. Also, the only hotel restaurant open the night we stayed, other than the gourmet one which did not suit our son, was outdoors. Although it was July being outdoors in the evening was a bit chilly so we decided to eat elsewhere and we found there were dozens of places to choose from within a stones throw of the hotel (and a lot cheaper) which was great.
reviews.title: Dream weekend in an amazing place!
Amazing Room but with AC problems
reviews.text: Overall a great base to explore the city.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiancée and I stayed two nights to celebrate the end of her MA - but mainly so we could watch the world's greatest band Simple Minds play the outdoor theatre.
reviews.title: Just not the luxury you expect for the money

reviews.text: What a show - and what a hotel! The staff were a delight, the location stunning. Nothing was too much trouble. Our room was great and had the biggest bed we've ever seen. No probs with the AC as others have mentioned.
reviews.title: Overdue for an overhaul!

reviews.text: This is such a unique hotel in an amazing location. We found the service to be lovely from the porters who drove us through the cite (!) to the front desk staff. The rooms are comfortable and large (we had a family room) and it was a thrill to look out over the old medieval cite. Breakfast was good, lots to choose from. The pool was beautiful and surprisingly quiet. The Basicalla is quite a backdrop to an afternoon dip. My children were amazed and rated Carcassonne and the hotel above Disney World!
reviews.title: Unique Hotel

reviews.text: The only negative was the lack of really efficient air conditioning. It was very hot in France however it wasnt unbearable and I considered it a trade off for staying in such a beautiful location.
reviews.title: Hotter than HADES- no a/c in a luxury hotel??? HORRIBLE!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Horrible. Hotter than hot outside and the room had NO functioning air conditioner. I asked the front desk to fix it in the afternoon and when we all came back from a late dinner, it still wasn't fixed. I was told by an employee that they had had all sorts of problems with the a/c but management had decided to wait until September to fix it. Oh, ok. Cannot reccomend.
reviews.title: Very elegant & charming hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 lovely nights in this hotel smack in the middle of the old cite. Great rooms and mouth-watering food. It's got an amazing location if like us, you wanted to dwell in this fortress. The staff were a little reserved but we put that down to perhaps the image they wanted to maintain. Yet, a smile or two would've been welcome. On the whole, lovely hotel for a romantic stay.
reviews.title: A delightful one night stand.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enough has been said about Carcassonne being a tad (ahem) touristy. It is. This hotel is a haven in the chaos! Organisation getting you in to the town is seamless – simply follow the signs that say for hotel guests and you end up in a huge car park within the ramparts where you abandon your car and are ferried to reception (we were advised not to leave valuables in the car).
reviews.title: ... one of the best hotel we ever had ...

description: Standing between two historic landmarks, the Roman Chateau Comtal and the Gothic Basilica of Saint-Nazaire, the Hotel de la Cite is set in its own glorious gardens. With its solid stone walls, wood paneling and stained-glass windows, the Hotel offers luxurious hospitality and award winning cuisine in its two restaurants.
